attributes.action: Develop a national railway program to re-instate many of the lines that were closed in the 1960's that served what are now, as a result of subsequent housing and economic development, sizeable towns and villages
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Many railway lines were axed in the 1960s under the Beeching Report closures, as they were deemed uneconomic. If these railways were still present they would serve what are now, as a result of subsequent housing and economic development, sizeable towns and villages. Had we still the railway network that existing back then, would we now have the congestion, pollution, CO2 and traffic problems we have today?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
